query: Which planet is also called the World?
answer: Earth, also called the world and, less frequently, Gaia \(and Terra in some works of science fiction\) is the third planet from the Sun, the densest planet in the Solar System, the largest of the Solar System's four terrestrial planets, and the only astronomical object known to accommodate life\.

According to evidence from radiometric dating and other sources, Earth was formed around four and a half billion years ago\.

query: Which planet was formed around four and a half billion years ago?
answer: According to evidence from radiometric dating and other sources, Earth was formed around four and a half billion years ago\.

query: When did the earliest life on Earth arise?
answer: Within its first billion years, life appeared in its oceans and began to affect its atmosphere and surface, promoting the proliferation of aerobic as well as anaerobic organisms and causing the formation of the atmosphere's ozone layer\.|The earliest life on Earth arose at least 3\.5 billion years ago\.
